title: Armenian (1917) Bible
description: The 1917 Armenian Bible, published by the American Bible Society, marks a pivotal moment in the distribution of the Christian scriptures among Armenian-speaking communities globally. This publication catered to the spiritual needs of Armenians, not only in their ancestral lands but also within the expansive Armenian diaspora, including significant populations in Turkey and beyond. The release of this Bible edition coincides with a tumultuous period in Armenian history, offering spiritual solace and a connection to cultural heritage amidst adversity. The American Bible Society's involvement underscores the international effort to ensure access to religious texts for Armenians during a time of significant upheaval and displacement. This edition of the Bible is a testament to the resilience of the Armenian spirit and the global Christian community's support, aiding in the preservation of Armenian religious and cultural identity through the medium of their ancient language.
